title: Sensible
description: Practical and logical; having common sense.

title: Sensitive
description: Easily affected by things; feeling or showing a high degree of emotion.

title: Sentimental legacy
description: The emotional history and objects a person leaves behind that have personal meaning.

title: Settle down
description: To become calmer or more stable; to start living a regular life.

title: Shook
description: To be very surprised or emotionally upset.

title: Silent support
description: Encouragement that is not spoken out loud but is still there.

title: Slip one's mind
description: To forget something.

title: Smuggling
description: The illegal act of moving goods or people from one country to another.

title: Snatched
description: To be very well-dressed and stylish.

title: Sophomore
description: A student in the second year of high school or college.

title: Soul healer
description: Someone or something that helps heal a person emotionally or spiritually.

title: Speak one's mind
description: To say exactly what you think, even if it is unpopular or offensive.

title: Start-up
description: A new business that has just been started.

title: Steering wheel
description: The wheel that a driver uses to control the direction of a vehicle.

title: Stern
description: Serious and strict.

title: Stopgap measure
description: A temporary solution to a problem.

title: Studs
description: Small metal or plastic pieces that are pushed through a piercing in the body, such as an earring.

title: Suspect
description: A person who is thought to have committed a crime or done something wrong.

title: Sustainable
description: Able to be maintained at a certain rate or level; environmentally friendly.

title: Susurration
description: A soft, whispering sound.

title: Swamped
description: To be overwhelmed with a lot of work or tasks.

title: Swoothy
description: Having a stylish look.

title: Sweep under the rug
description: To hide or ignore a problem, especially a scandalous or embarrassing one.

title: Tailgate
description: To follow another vehicle too closely.

title: Take something in
description: To understand and remember something; to make clothing narrower.

title: Take something up
description: To start a new hobby or activity.
